Description: Fragment of body of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery slim neck-amphora. Parts of two women in procession towards the right: dividing band of white dots with dark centres: angle of wing of bird (as on Pl. GB 582, GR 1888.2-8.81.b). Purple on cloak. White for flesh. Purple stripe and row of white dots on wing.
Curator's comments: BSA xlvii, 128-B.6. Chemical analysis done by Prof. H. Mommsen (Helmholtz-Institut, Bonn) in 2004 found a similarity to "Group E" (North Ionian Group: Smyrna/Clazomenai)
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 587, 7)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 116)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.57 fig.8, Table 1)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.119, p.120, fig.6, p.125)
